comments:
There is a extra ">" included in our plugin.xml file by mistake:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?eclipse version="3.0"?>
<plugin> ------------------------> extra ">" before attribute
   name = "%name"
   id = "com.ibm.ims9.doc.og"
   version = "9.1.1"
   provider-name = "IBM">

   <extension point="org.eclipse.help.toc">
     <toc file="ogtoc.xml" primary="true" />
   </extension>

</plugin>

So when we failed to start our help system in this situation. But we can't get 
a information like "there is a error in your xxx plugin.xml file..." in the 
log file:

There's no indication where the problem is or even what the problem is.  A 
couple of us
here spent several hours troubleshooting this.

eclispe should provide an error indicating what file and what line in
the file caused the problem.  

So it took us a lot of time to solve this problem....
Reassigning to platform runtime as this relates to the loading of plugins ar runtime.

The stacktrace is coming from update.configurator and it looks like it prevents update configurator from starting.  I tried this on the latest 3.3 build and it seems to be fixed.  If the plugin.xml is malformed then update.configurator seems to log a message about the bad plugin.xml and continues.

Moving to update for comment and closure.  Also note that this is a legacy plug-in that does not contain a proper OSGi bundle manifest.  If this bug is not magically fixed in the latest builds then I suggest you close as wontfix, most everyone should be migrated to real OSGi bundles by now.
